title: letteredhub
author: letteredhub
content: A whole lot is going on in our society's today through different channels, and the social media is one of such. There's a whole lot on socials that  many persons haven't taken into consideration as they get carried away with the events and cruise going on on social media platforms to the length that they compromise their privacy and security at the expense of social media cruise catching and fun.There's a fast growing trend on social media platforms over the years now which caught my attention. An instance, like on Instagram or Facebook where a stranger will just make up a post asking interested persons to drop their phone contact numbers so they could be added to a hot Whatsapp group or a platform where they would have to connect with men and women for dating and sex talks, or have access to funny jokes/memes etc. Then you will notice a lot of phone contacts dropping like when it's raining. And I get amazed by what these persons really believe to achieve by exposing their contacts freely and easily to the public.Here's a few probable factors you should bear in mind next time you want to do that:1. Anyone can see and have access to your contact any day anytime as long as such social media platforms like the Facebook for instance still exists. And more often than not, it may not be your targeted person's or reason as to why you gave up your contact. what I call wrong target.2. You may end up being bugged constantly with calls by strangers, not just any strangers but wrong and parasitic strangers.3. You can easily be traced, accessed by persons with evil intentions, and moreso, sometimes these contacts are contact numbers we might have used as part of a requirement from an online registration of some financial account or instrument. If you're observed to be one rich folk some bad dudes might wanna clone your contact number (I don't know how they possibly do that) and be receiving certain vital financial related informations that could be used with a brute-force to crack down your asset and others, etc.All this post is just particularly about is that don't get carried away by the antics of social media platforms as there are more wolves than folks.

comments.author: Chilwell
comments.body: I was a victim of this situation, before I used to believe the Facebook advertisement and the sharing of phone numbers. Throughout this time, I was carried away until I was duped, at that point I realized my errors.I just saw an advertisement on Facebook for the sale of eggs and the prices was amazing, if I purchase I will get a lot of gain, if I sell in my own place. what really encouraged me is that you will receive the eggs before the payment then I starting to put calls across to confirm whether it is legit, which I confirm by contacting the number I saw there. We all reached an agreement with them that I will pay after receiving the goods, few hours later I received a call from them telling me that for me to get the goods in time I have to pay a sum of #5000 before getting the goods fast, since I'm eager to get it I then rush and send the money to them. After all this process they called again to request for another money again, from this stage I began to realise I mess up, that is how my just go. I then start to receive phone call from different persons claiming to help me get me my eggs. This is how I know disadvantage of advert on social media platform.We should be careful not all adverts are real.

comments.author: Belarge
comments.body: Op you are so right, I read between lines and sincerely what you have said is true and so educating,Sincerely I don't really know what the world is turning into, I remember those days when phone numbers and other personal confidential data are been valued, but now it's not like that anymore, many people just believe as long that post is about making money online, hook up, sexchat etc, that they would drop their contact, forgetting the level of risk that follows,Imagine you been in a serious relationship with someone and you drop your contact on Facebook for a sex talk or whatever and your spouse sees it, believe me it might crumble your relationship,Thanks Op I really appreciate you for this wonderful write up, I hope anyone who see it will read and learn,Our personal or confidential data's should always be our secret except there is a notable reason before it should be given out, the world is not smiling again, anything can happen

comments.author: yhiaali3
comments.body: I find it stupid for someone to put their phone number on social media, that would put their privacy at great risk.There are a lot of scammers and criminals who take advantage of social media, especially open groups, to prey on their victims. There are many ugly stories of fraud, sextortion, or other hateful crimes.Therefore, everyone, especially young people, must be warned of the need to exercise extreme caution and not display any information that violates privacy on social media.

comments.author: 348Judah
comments.body: I kike one thing about this topic, which is the prompt advice not to be easily distracted or get carried away in life, sometimes we are after something and in this pursuit, we let other unnecessary distractions weigh us down and cause us to loose focus in achieving the most important pursuits in life, which is a clear indication that if you're not after something, then take heed because something might be after you.

comments.author: Qiubell5
comments.body: Social media does affect life. Many people get carried away, just want the fun and don't think about the risks. Actually, social media is not a safe place. We also have to be wise in choosing good and bad content.

comments.author: Alpha Marine
comments.body: Aside from not exposing your phone number or email, you have to be careful with the kind of calls you receive from unknown numbers. Somehow how these guys have a way of sourcing people's phone numbers. They may call you and tell you all sorts of juicy propositions and deals, they're all scams. Also the kind of places you register with your email. Be very careful with the kind of sites you give out your emails to. A lot of them are just phishing sites. The kind of apps you grant permission to on your phone is also a way for scammers to target you. Only grant permission to your contacts, location, and other sensitive things to trusted apps if you must. You have to make a conscious effort to protect yourself from scams because they come in different and sophisticated ways.

comments.author: Iadegbola34
comments.body: I completely agree with your points about the risks of sharing personal information on social media. It is essential to be cautious about who we give access to our contact details as we can never know what their intentions might be. We should always be vigilant and protect our privacy and security by being careful about the information we share online.Furthermore, it is also crucial to remember that once we put our information out there, it becomes public property and can easily be misused. We should always think twice before giving out any personal information, especially our contact details, and only do so when necessary.

comments.author: yazher
comments.body: Also, there is something called voice phishing where they can mimic the voice of a person you know and might fool you to borrow money from you. This is why phone numbers now a day are crucial information, especially in those countries where their phone numbers are also connected to their personal information. When it comes to your details, you should be extra careful and not publicly post them as if it's just a normal random image on the internet because anything can be done against you from there and you will have a hard time undoing it once it spread and used for criminal activities and others.
